pain_points_original.title: Strict Data Sovereignty & Security Compliance
pain_points_original.description: AGS handles sensitive government legal matters and cannot use standard AI tools. The solution MUST be certified via the "IRAP process at PROTECTED level" (NFR-SEC01) and ensure all customer data is "stored and processed within the Australian Region" (NFR-SEC04) to meet PSPF requirements.

pain_points_original.title: Lawyer Productivity & Administrative Burden
pain_points_original.description: With "approximately 570 lawyers", manual admin reduces billable capacity. AGS needs to automate low-value tasks like "Draft daily time recording summaries" based on calendar/activity metadata and "Draft document from Standard Request" to "improve productivity across legal practice workflows."

pain_points_original.title: Complex Evidence Review & Inconsistency Detection
pain_points_original.description: Manual review of large discovery sets is inefficient and prone to error. AGS requires AI to "Identify relevant documents in large discovery sets" and perform advanced analysis to "Identify inconsistencies across evidence" (e.g., contradictions in witness statements/affidavits).

pain_points_original.title: Lack of Australian Legal Context & Style
pain_points_original.description: Generic AI models often cite foreign law or wrong formats. AGS specifically requires tools "designed to support Australian legal practices" that can enforce "AGS style and plain English rules" across their 40 areas of law, ensuring outputs are jurisdictionally accurate.

pain_points_original.title: Siloed Workflows & Integration Failures
pain_points_original.description: AGS aims to "supplement rather than replace" existing capability. A pain point is AI that stands alone; the solution must integrate with "iManage Cloud, Elite 3E and the Microsoft Office suite" to ensure seamless adoption by the 800 staff without breaking existing matter management workflows.
